title: Chapter 4: Abstraction - Quiz
description: Comprehensive test of abstract base classes, ABC module, abstractmethod, interfaces, and concrete implementations

questions.question: What is abstraction in OOP?

options.text: Hiding implementation details, showing only essentials

questions.explanation: Abstraction hides complex implementation details and exposes only essential features.

questions.question: What module provides abstract base classes?
questions.explanation: The 'abc' (Abstract Base Classes) module provides abstraction support.

questions.question: What is ABC class used for?
questions.explanation: ABC is the base class that enables creation of abstract classes.

questions.question: What decorator marks methods as abstract?
questions.explanation: @abstractmethod decorator marks methods that must be implemented by subclasses.

questions.question: Can you instantiate an abstract class?
questions.explanation: Attempting to instantiate an abstract class raises TypeError.

questions.question: What happens if subclass doesn't implement abstract method?
questions.explanation: Subclass becomes abstract too if it doesn't implement all abstract methods.

questions.question: What is an interface in Python?

options.text: Abstract class with only abstract methods

questions.explanation: Python implements interfaces as abstract classes with all abstract methods.

questions.question: What is a concrete class?
questions.explanation: Concrete class implements all abstract methods and can be instantiated.

questions.question:
How to inherit from ABC?
```python
from abc import ABC
class MyClass(ABC):
    pass
```
questions.explanation: Inherit from ABC by including it in class definition: class MyClass(ABC).

questions.question: What's the purpose of abstract methods?
questions.explanation: Abstract methods define a contract that subclasses must implement.

questions.question: Can abstract classes have concrete methods?
questions.explanation: Abstract classes can have both abstract and concrete (implemented) methods.

questions.question: What is @abstractproperty used for?
questions.explanation: @abstractproperty is deprecated; combine @property with @abstractmethod instead.

questions.question: Can abstract methods have default implementation?
questions.explanation: Abstract methods can have default implementation that subclasses extend via super().
Cannot instantiate abstract class with abstract methods - raises TypeError.

questions.question: Which imports ABC correctly?
questions.explanation: Import ABC from abc module: from abc import ABC, abstractmethod.

questions.question: What is duck typing related to?

options.text: If it walks/quacks like duck, treat as duck

questions.explanation: Duck typing focuses on behavior over explicit types - if object has needed methods, use it.

questions.question: Why use abstraction?
questions.explanation: Abstraction enforces interface contracts and provides clear structure.

questions.question: Can you use isinstance() with ABC?
questions.explanation: isinstance() works with ABC to check if object inherits from abstract base.

questions.question: What is Template Method pattern?
questions.explanation: Template Method: abstract class defines algorithm structure, subclasses fill in steps.

questions.question: Can static methods be abstract?
questions.explanation: Static methods can be abstract using @abstractmethod with @staticmethod.

questions.question: Abstract classes can be instantiated.
questions.explanation: Abstract classes with abstract methods cannot be instantiated.

questions.question: @abstractmethod must be used with ABC inheritance.
questions.explanation: @abstractmethod requires class to inherit from ABC to function properly.

questions.question: Concrete classes implement all abstract methods.
questions.explanation: Concrete classes must implement all inherited abstract methods to be instantiable.

questions.question: Abstract classes can have constructors.
questions.explanation: Abstract classes can have __init__ methods called by subclasses via super().

questions.question: Python has a native 'interface' keyword.
questions.explanation: Python doesn't have 'interface' keyword; uses abstract classes instead.

questions.question: Abstract methods can have implementation.
questions.explanation: Abstract methods can have default implementation that subclasses can extend.

questions.question: Duck typing is related to abstraction.
questions.explanation: Duck typing focuses on behavior (methods/properties) rather than explicit type.

questions.question: Subclass must override all abstract methods.
questions.explanation: Subclass must implement all abstract methods to become concrete and instantiable.

questions.question: ABC class is imported from abstractions module.
questions.explanation: ABC is imported from 'abc' module, not 'abstractions'.

questions.question: Abstraction helps enforce contracts.
questions.explanation: Abstraction enforces that subclasses implement required interface methods.

questions.question: Valid ABC imports? (Select all)
questions.explanation: All forms importing from 'abc' module are valid. 'abstract' module doesn't exist.

questions.question: Abstract class can have? (Select all)
questions.explanation: Abstract classes can have abstract methods, concrete methods, and constructors.

questions.question: Characteristics of abstraction? (Select all)
questions.explanation: Abstraction hides complexity, enforces contracts, provides structure - not speed.

questions.question: Abstract decorators? (Select all)
questions.explanation: @abstractmethod is primary; others deprecated. @interface doesn't exist.

questions.question: Benefits of abstraction? (Select all)
questions.explanation: Abstraction provides contracts, maintainability, polymorphism - not automatic testing.

questions.question: Complete: Import ABC
questions.explanation: Import ABC and abstractmethod from 'abc' module.

questions.question: Complete: Define abstract class
questions.explanation: Inherit from ABC to create abstract class.

questions.question: Complete: Abstract method decorator
questions.explanation: Use @abstractmethod decorator to mark abstract methods.

questions.question: Complete: Implement abstract method
questions.explanation: Implement abstract method in subclass with same signature.

questions.question: Complete: Call super in abstract method
questions.explanation: Use super() to call parent's abstract method implementation.

questions.question: Create Abstract Class
questions.description: Create abstract Animal class with abstract method make_sound(). Subclass Dog must implement it.
questions.starterCode:
from abc import ABC, abstractmethod

# Create abstract Animal class

# Create Dog subclass that implements make_sound

questions.question: Multiple Abstract Methods
questions.description: Create abstract Shape with abstract methods area() and perimeter(). Implement Rectangle.
questions.starterCode:
from abc import ABC, abstractmethod

# Create Shape with area and perimeter methods

# Create Rectangle subclass

questions.question: Abstract with Concrete Methods
questions.description: Create Vehicle with abstract start() and concrete method stop() that returns 'Stopped'.
questions.starterCode:
from abc import ABC, abstractmethod

# Create Vehicle with abstract start and concrete stop

# Create Car that implements start

questions.question: Interface Pattern
questions.description: Create Drawable interface (all abstract methods: draw, resize). Implement Circle class.
questions.starterCode:
from abc import ABC, abstractmethod

# Create Drawable interface

# Create Circle implementing Drawable

questions.question: Abstract Property
questions.description: Create abstract class with abstract property 'name' using @property and @abstractmethod.
questions.starterCode:
from abc import ABC, abstractmethod

# Create Person with abstract name property

# Create Student implementing name

parts.question: What is ABC?
parts.explanation: ABC stands for Abstract Base Class.

parts.question: Abstract classes cannot be instantiated
parts.explanation: Abstract classes with abstract methods cannot be instantiated.

parts.question: Subclass must implement abstract methods
parts.explanation: Concrete subclass must implement all abstract methods.

parts.question: What if subclass doesn't implement?
parts.explanation: Subclass becomes abstract if it doesn't implement all.

parts.question: What is concrete class?
parts.explanation: Concrete class implements all methods and can be instantiated.

parts.question: Concrete classes can be instantiated
parts.explanation: Concrete classes have all methods implemented.

parts.question: Concrete class must? (Select all)
parts.explanation: Concrete implements abstracts, is instantiable, provides implementations.

parts.question: Python has 'interface' keyword
parts.explanation: Python uses abstract classes for interfaces.

parts.question: How to create interface?
parts.explanation: Interface is abstract class with all abstract methods.

parts.question: Interfaces enforce contracts
parts.explanation: Interfaces define contract that implementers must follow.

parts.question: What is Template Method?
parts.explanation: Template Method defines algorithm skeleton in abstract class.

parts.question: Subclasses override specific steps
parts.explanation: Subclasses implement abstract steps of algorithm.

parts.question: Template Method uses? (Select all)
parts.explanation: Uses abstract and concrete methods with inheritance.
